data.text: Albert E. Cowdrey in LOCUS Magazine: https://t.co/MqKmrqQKe7

Dr. Albert E. Cowdrey (1933-2022) was known for his great wit, wealth of knowledge, extensive nonfiction books & novels, his service as a veteran, historical & educator, and his more than 60 published stories, many in @fandsf. His most recent story appeared in May/June 2022. https://t.co/0IEUFkcBop

urls.title: GEOMETRIES OF BELONGING
urls.description: R.B. LEMBERG November 2022   978-1-958880-01-2 trade paperback ​Order below, or buy print or ebooks of this title from these dealers. Nebula and Locus award finalist Lemberg returns us to the Birdverse with this powerful collection. The intricate Birdverse has at its core a magic based loosely in geometry, from which comes healing, love, and art. It is a complex, culturally diverse world, a realm with LGBTQIA characters and a wide range of family configurations. Lemberg probes the obstacles behind traditional social boundaries of cultures; overseeing this world is the deity Bird and all its incarnations. Each story and poem, exqusitely crafted, will richly reward long-time fans and newcomers alike.  ​

@fandsf @BrandonCase101 Apologies for not asking privately, I won’t tweet such qs going forward. I assumed no one looks at my tweets and didn’t want to bother busy editors especially as always got rejection emails oof I guess I shot myself in the foot and made even more work for you. I'm sorry.
just gonna write the things I like, hang out where I feel good, and see what happens

And now it is forever."
Greg Bear, Blood Music

tweets.text:
We're in F&SF Mag! 
Charles de Lint was kind enough to review Putting the Fact in Fantasy for the September/October of @fandsf magazine. "Is it essential reading? For writers, I'd say yes." 
https://t.co/lcdRdYDB8U https://t.co/c95BrGSqAP

And then, in January, my short story "Prison Colony Optimization Protocols" appeared in the Jan/Feb issue of Fantasy and Science Fiction, @fandsf 

I'd appreciate any boost I can get for all this! I'm very proud of my work this year and would love to see it recognized! 5/5

'These Brilliant Forms' came out in the March/April issue of @fandsf and introduced my Greek-Cypriot space captain, Eleni Tomasis, and her crew (including Caliphrax, the Void Witch). I'm querying a novel that tells their story - and is part of the 'Laocoön's Children' universe! https://t.co/SLh7XIXwqW

Finally: my novella 'One Day I Will' made the cover of @fandsf September/October issue - and I'm so grateful to @blackpotmojo for the incredible opportunity (and to @megelison for valuing queer, erotic SF in her @UncannyMagazine article!) <3 https://t.co/8DZ98ddMCq

I don't know how awards work (yet) but happy to see all your work being showcased. I published two stories in @fandsf.  "VOID" in March/April and "The Wild Son" in July/Aug . A W for me is pick up a copy if you haven't already and read all the great stories.  (Please retweet.)

annotations.normalized_text: Tithe the Bones, Sell the Blood

urls.title: Beneath Ceaseless Skies - Tithe the Bones, Sell the Blood by Auston Habershaw
urls.description: The cards were crisp, almost brittle in Cédric’s hands; he ran his thumbs along the corners as he shuffled, feeling where he’d marked them during the game with the same needle in his ring he’d used to draw the blood to let him keep gambling. It all came down to this hand, this moment. The moment he was going to cheat the dead at their own table.

urls.title: BSFA Awards 2022: Longlist Nomination
urls.description: Please nominate up to four works in the relevant categories. The works you nominate must have been published in 2022. You may not nominate your own work. You must be a member of the BSFA in order to take part in award nominations and voting. If you don't yet have or can't find your membership number, that's OK, but if you can supply it it makes it easier for us to check your membership status. Please note that for the purposes of the Awards, a novel must be 40,000 words or over, and short fiction is anything under 40,000 words. Each member may nominate a maximum of four works in each category.

urls.title: The Horny Body Problem - Uncanny Magazine
urls.description: Short stories are a lot like sex. There are only so many variations of what you can do, writer tops reader, reader comes hungry to bottom. But every angle seems inventive, every person brings their own art to both writing and reading that it feels new every time. We can write in teams and read […]

tweets.text:
But we’re all still horny, aren’t we? Horny to write, horny to read, horny to lube up and slide sex into the narratives that take us to the stars, to the haunted house, to the enchanted forest. 

https://t.co/wedJGLzFQ1
